column4: ok I want to make a wmv(or flash or anything that these people can view with windows) file out of an avi file that was encoded with xvid,
you can watch xvid on windows...
ya if we install a codec..wich i have no problem with doing but the it guys hate that idea
i find it supriseing they dont allready have the divx codec or a dozen other codecs allready installed..
gnome and kde bothj have a 'session manager' feature that lets you do that. depending on theapps.
you are not being very clear as to what you want..
you could make a script that  you double click to launch  several apps if thats what youi are wanting.
learn to do it right then i guess?  :) make a simple script  shoulden tbe too hard.
you havent used kde4 then have you?
it was already there? see this machine came with ubuntu preinstalled and it did not have a home dir shortcut anywhere
i have am using my old HOME on a lot of my machines.. so its hard to tell what is default.. but im pretty sure gettting a  Home icon on the gnome desktop is rather trivial.
you could just put a soft link from /home/whatever to /home/whatever/Desktop/Home   if you wanted
most people dont even resize the features fuse can do.      and yes i find gnomes remote dir stuff flakey also.
you could just set up a few scripts that run the proper commands.
you could see where it mounts and make a link from it to someplace easier to access I guess
ya, but then how the kde apps look at is bizzar if its a shortcut...grrrrr...
latest release of gnome did a lot of changes in that area. a lot of those features dont work very well for me any more either. Gnome file manager here dosent even see most shares.
a 'soft link' to a mountpoint is not a shortcut. all apps should access thefiles fine with a link
could be some server is having problems.. they took a lot of 'load' in the last few days.
